text: Hi Everyone.  Unfortunately there isn't an API endpoint available for creating new quotes in the CRM.  Anyone know if there is an undocumented endpoint available?

<@UGMGP7A72> You can inline those directly into the module html + hubl section.

for instance if you have a module that is just an anchor tag with properties for top and bottom padding it might look like this

```<div class="module-wrapper" style="{{module.padding_top}}px; {{module.padding_bottom}}px;">
<a href=""></a>
</div>```
This is totally fine inlining these styles as long as you dont intend on fixing them someplace else.  If you want to make it look cleaner you can wrap that whole section up in a hubl variable

```{% set adv_styles = module.padding_top + "px; " + module.padding_bottom + "px" %} ```
Then you can set that in inlined styles instead of writing it all out. Looks a little bit cleaner. Especially if you are rolling out a bunch of custom settings.
Anyone getting strange intermittent issues using the page editor tool?
Having multiple teammates in multiple portals report seeing this:

The page is now public. It is not yet in the menus  for a technical reason (working on that) it is also findable in search.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/modules/files>

And to clarify, this specifically highlights the options for how you can handle code related to modules. Being that modules are the smallest but most impactful building block It will help you think about how you build themes.

I want to display <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/cos-general/how-to-use-personalization-with-your-content|Personalized content> to a website visitor whose contact info is stored in the CRM; let's call her Jane. But instead of Personalizing the website content based on Jane's contact record data - I want to show Jane: Jack's contact info (who is also stored in the CRM). Is this doable without writing a server-side script and hitting the contacts API? My current solution is to store Jacks HubSpot user ID in a custom property on Jane's record then query the Contacts API to render Jacks info on the site for Jane - but I'd much rather do this without writing server side code if it's possible in the CMS - thanks!
